div.div: Pike County School Corporation's Vision is to build a legacy of academic excellence for all students.
The Mission of the Pike County School Corporation is to provide all students with a quality education that encourages them to become successful citizens.

nav.div: Pike County School Corporation » News » What's New » School Closure

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; text-align: start; letter-spacing: normal;
div.span: Pike County School Corporation will be closed from March 16 to April 3. Students will be provided eLearning assignments for March 16 to March 20, and for March 30 to April 3. In observance of Spring Break, no assignments will be posted for the week of March 23 to March 27. All students should take home textbooks, notebooks, school supplies, electronic devices or any personal items that may be needed during the next 3 weeks.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; text-align: start; letter-spacing: normal;

color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; text-align: start; letter-spacing: normal;
div.span: All staff members need to report to work on Monday, March 16 at their regular time. Meetings will be held to review any final plans or preparations for the extended closure. Additional information regarding the provision of school breakfast and lunch, arrangements for picking up medicine, any special accommodations, or any other details will be provided to families by Monday, March 16 through social media and school reach calls.
